Title: Object: The Departure of Abram and Lot from Egypt
Description: Figures preparing for a journey, near a pool filled from a waterfall over rocks on the right, including two men talking on the left, in front of a laden camel, a woman holding a bundle and a pet dog, another behind her holding a child, a third sitting on the right, helping a child to drink while another child leans against her shoulder, a boy driving livestock towards the water in the centre, with a man on horseback followerd by others, proceeding along a path in the background towards a town; after Zuccarelli; with production details only. 1777 Etching and engraving
Bibliographic references: Calabi & De Vesme 1928 / Francesco Bartolozzi. Catalogue des estampes et notice biographique d'après les manuscrits de A. De Vesme entièrement réformés et complétés d'une étude critique par A. Calabi (2475.III)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev John Burleigh James (Lugt 425)
